reviewTitle: If you just want a basic iPad for a great price, this is it
reviewDescription: As my review title says - If you just want a basic iPad for a great price, this is it - while it lasts! Although the 9th gen iPad has an older design with a larger bezel and TouchID home button, it still works great as a basic tablet to do simple things. The most common activities - browsing the internet, checking email, chatting through Facetime, reading news, and playing basic arcade games - do not require you to have the latest, greatest, and more expensive iPads when this one can do it all without compromise or a reduction in experience.The fact that the current pricing is $80 under MSRP makes it a steal; at this price, I don't see why one would buy some inferior tablet from other brands when a genuine Apple iPad can be had for under $250! But of course, this price can only last so long, so if you want a basic but high-quality, fully functioning tablet, you can't go wrong here.

The only reason I didn’t give this 5 stars is because the shipping was pushed back a couple times and I actually got it later than expected. And in their defense the area it was shipped from had snow and ice so that was probably the culpritThis was a present for my 16 year old niece and she loves it. She can watch her shows and Facetime her friends, I honestly haven’t seen her without it since it came so all around great gift, great price…

I purchase this iPad just as transient iPad while I recover my iPad Pro which I lost at airport security. It has a simpler functions than the pro but I was happy to download my data from the cloud and be solvent again. The iPad is very light and the screen is cheap and easily breakable which makes it an almost disposable iPad for kids unless you use an armoured cover to protect it. The price is just right.

This iPad fills my needs. I surf the web, send and receive email, create and save documents, create calendar reminders, stream music... fairly basic usage. It does so fairly quickly and smoothly. Downloading Google apps made for easy transition from Android.

Tends to say connected to internet but won’t load anything until the Wi-Fi is turned off and then turned back on.  Doesn’t do this with other devices that I have.  Very odd.  Overall, Apple makes a good tablet.

reviewTitle: A great iPad at a great price.
reviewDescription: I didn’t need a full blown top of the line iPad, but I wanted one that would do everything I wanted.This generation works well for me. It is like my iPhone, but larger. I can work with all types of documents, manage my accounts, sink everything with my phone and laptop and have a screen that is comfortable for reading books and watching movies.I am extremely happy that finally bought one.
My first venture to Apple, so had a few quirks to learn, but did not take long. It seems most apps have been designed for Apple, so more universal. Pleased.
bought this for my daughter who lives in the virgin islands... this unit worked great for a year+ .. just out of warranty and the unit would not respond to the screen...

reviewTitle: Good budget choice as the lowest-priced current iPad
reviewDescription: Does almost everything you want an iPad to do, supports all of the apps that I have seen or used, has a good size screen and supports 1st generation Apple Pencil and bluetooth keyboards if you want these items.  Very satisfied.  However, note that if you intend to use the iPad for artistic work you may be happier with one that supports the second generation Apple Pencil that has a more "paper-like" feel on the display surface and has a sensor for how much pressure you are putting on the point (the newest USB-C Apple Pencil is not supported on the 9th generation iPad and, by-the-way, the newest. Pencil also does not have pressure sensitivity even on the models that support the second generation Pencil).  Other models are smaller, lighter, bigger, and/or faster (e.g., for games or apps like Photoshop) but all of this at added cost.

reviewTitle: First time user of Apple product
reviewDescription: Apple is really hard to learn.  Not used to this product.  First time user of Apple.

reviewTitle: Unmatched Performance and Versatility – Apple's 9th Generation iPad Shines
reviewDescription: The Apple iPad (9th Generation) is a technological marvel that seamlessly combines power and versatility. Fueled by the A13 Bionic chip, this iPad delivers a level of performance that stands out in its class. The 10.2-inch Retina Display is a visual feast, offering crisp and vibrant images, making every video, photo, and application come to life. With a capacious 64GB storage, I found ample space for my apps, files, and multimedia without a hitch. The 12MP front and 8MP back cameras capture stunning photos and videos, making this iPad equally adept for creative pursuits and video calls. The inclusion of Touch ID adds a layer of security, and the all-day battery life ensures uninterrupted productivity or entertainment. In Silver, the iPad exudes elegance, making it not just a gadget but a style statement. Apple's 9th Generation iPad is undeniably a powerhouse, setting the bar high for tablets in terms of performance, display quality, and overall user experience.

Purchased this iPad for my sister who is new to the table world. This is an excellent iPad for beginners, as well as for more advanced people. The display is great for streaming movies and for personal pictures. Best of all is the price. Excellent quality!

reviewTitle: Surprisingly Great! An Affordable and Comparable Option
reviewDescription: I'm the kind of person who prefers to have newer versions of products, but decided to give this one as a gift to someone who has never used an Apple product. This model was affordable and only a couple of years old, so I thought it would still fair pretty well for what this person wanted to use it for. Let me just say, this product blew my expectations right out of the water. It works extremely well! It's not slow, laggy, or constantly freezing/crashing. It works well with the first-generation Apple Pencil, connects easily via Bluetooth, and has great touch-screen sensation. It easily runs the Procreate and Canva apps and is able to keep other apps in the background without issue. I am very pleasantly surprised about this, as I was expecting a cheap, old product. If you are looking for an iPad to use for art/graphic design or are a student looking for an affordable option, this one is definitely for you!

reviewTitle: Best entry device for the apple ecosystem
reviewDescription: It's not just a purchase, It's an investment I should say. For a good price of 270$ you get a great tablet, with great battery, handful of polished software, and latest ipad OS.Evident Pros:The battery life is admirable. In my experience so far, it ocassionaly withstands 2 days before having 17-22% just before I recharge it. Worth to mention however, I don't use it for any mild-heavy gaming.The UI and the OS itself make the tablet a big win for art, study, and partially productivity work. It's very reliable.Nice responsive smooth screen. It's bright, colorful, and the panel is pretty qualitative, and what's important it's fairly repairable, so if you break the front glass it could be easily changed without the need to replace the whole screen.A13 processor. Let's not forget about that. Everything works smooth and fast from UI to the apps themselves.Shots to the overall quality of the product. It's very well-built what makes it feel like a more of a premium product for this money.Cons:The Camera unfortunately is only in the device for the sake of having a camera. If I wouldn't have to, I wouldn't take any photos on this thing. It's too unreliable.Have you seen the bezels of the screen? Having it's crazy specifications for its budget the front screen design makes it look like you bought a tablet from way back in 2016.Apple pen 1st gen. Seriously. Was it that hard to implement apple pen 2nd gen support? Come on apple, you don't even include the pen in the package.Absurd prices on accessories. I won't even care about these, since they cost more than a tablet itself lol
Bought this to help with my wife’s stroke recovery. Downloaded some apps for aphasia. Works really well. Holds a charge forever. Plus you can create some cool art on it. Very cool.

reviewTitle: Very great quality for a great price
reviewDescription: This was an upgrade to an older iPad I had for years. And although this isn’t necessarily the NEWEST iPad, this is incredibly high powered and has a lot of great functionality. The only misleading thing about the product on here is that it almost insinuates you get the pen stylist and keyboard, but it’s just the iPad you get. All in all a great purchase for a great price.

The iPad is a wonder to behold and to use. It is like a mini computer: somewhat limited, but very good at what it does. It is actually between a phone and a computer. It does everything your phone does, with a screen big enough to actually see! I love it and use it a lot. And it is durable and made to last. My old one is still working like a champ, but doesn't have the system or the features I now rely on.

First of all, the BATTERY LIFE is Excellent!  BUT if you are Newbie, battery life will SUCK!  Why?Because you are newbie!  Understand battery life takes into consideration how many things are turned on  and how much juice you are currently using.  Let me give you an example.Your Home is POWERED by electricity,  and the more stuff you have turned on, TV, air conditionair, fans, refrig,  freezer, etc ... the higher your electric bill.  Are you with me so far?  With the IPAD, apple wanted to impress you with WOW factor when you got your IPAD, so it turns on tons of stuff, and has lots of stuff going in the background, using POWER.  YOU the USER will have to turn OFF the features you are NOT USING to increase how LONG the battery lasts.WIFI, Bluetooth, screen brightness, games and apps... going in the background, might NEED to be TURNED OFF if you don't need them at the moment.  ( example you don't need to turn on A.C. in your home in the middle of winter).... watch YouTube videos for tips and pointers on turning off/on only the features you need at the moment and learn all the cool things this device can do.I made this review when I read a number of posts of NEWBIE'S saying they got the IPAD and returned it because the battery life sucks.

reviewTitle: Amazing drawing tablet when paired with the Apple Pencil
reviewDescription: Drawing feels natural: She loves using the Apple Pencil (sold separately, FYI) - it's like drawing on paper, but with way cooler possibilities. She spends hours creating colorful creatures and fantastical landscapes.Apps galore: There are tons of amazing art apps available, from kid-friendly drawing tools to pro-level software. We're obsessed with Procreate - it's like having a whole art studio in your pocket.Portable creativity: We can take this iPad anywhere, which is perfect for keeping her entertained on long car rides or doctor's appointments. Plus, it's lighter than lugging around a sketchbook and markers.A couple of things to keep in mind:Storage can fill up fast: If your kid is a digital art picasso like mine, you might need to upgrade to a larger storage option.Accessories add up: The Apple Pencil is essential, and there are cases, stands, and screen protectors to consider. Factor those into the cost.**Overall, the iPad (9th Gen) is a fantastic tool for budding artists. It's sparked my daughter's creativity and keeps her entertained for hours. Just be prepared for the potential of exploding app stores and a growing collection of drawing accessories.

I needed to buy a new iPad as my iPad mini 2 hasn't gotten an update in a few years. I don't use an iPad for much other than a reader and to watch video on so I really didn't "need" to buy another one. My mini still has great battery life. I still like it. The only thing that bothered me was some games required a newer IOS than what I had, but I generally game on my computer. I did want to put my bank's app on my iPad and that is the only reason I bought a new one. Being able to waste time at the doctor's office on a screen I can see is a huge plus. Battery life is very good and this iPad is much smoother than my old one. I've never used a laptop. I've owned a few and didn't like them. Too much of a hassle to carry with you on daily activities. I figure I got 3 more years of updates at the very least. Apple is still selling this "new" and they do support discontinued hardware for 3 years usually. Not always though.I guess time will tell.

reviewTitle: Nice quality and construction. Needs a phone to verify making an account to do anything useful.
reviewDescription: As someone who likes privacy, I found the phone requirement off-putting. I could buy a tablet for an open OS and download and use anything I wanted. This feels locked down and doesn't have freedom and privacy to it. I need to tie a phone to an account to download and play silly games on the ipad. It continually asks me to finish setting it up when I dont want siri or any of the other functions always listening to my conversations and logging that data.I can still use it for education or watching youtube, so I guess that's a plus. It comes with a number of apps which might be useful, and it can act as a personal daily planner. But without an appleID I cant unlock its full potential. I considered buying a burner phone just to deal with that, but then I asked "why should I have to go through another hoop? I should have the option to install things without requiring an ID on my personal machine and pay for them using the typical process that existed 20 years ago; cash or a credit card".Steam has never asked for my phone number to make or continue to have an account with it.

reviewTitle: No Sim card slot. Am done with Apple.
reviewDescription: Am done with apple. Not only has the hardware gone downhill, software and apps are horrible. With all of Apple ads touting its camera abilities, Storage, viewing, customization, personalization, renaming more than one photo, is all non existent. Customizable screen interface between tapping and swiping doesn't exist. No handicap settings for those of us with only one hand. Unfortunately only Microsoft offers any Customizations/Personalization. I don't like Windows 10/11 Windows 7 is still better.Please spare me the steve jobs aesthetics about Sim card slots its a ridiculous argument. The Apple Lightning SIM card adapter is has horrible looking as it is useless. Icloud is a slow joke. Am done with apple. Google is actually worse at photos than apple. Unfortunately it's going back to Windows is my only option.
We bought this ipad for our daughter for christmas. She loved it so much but after just 4 months it started glitching and malfunctioning.

reviewDescription: Verizon notified me that this is not the same as a cellular iPad. Which makes it pretty worth less unless you’re going to sync your iPhone to your iPad like a watch or use a different app. Disappointed as can be.

The size is awkward, too large to fit in my purse and carry with me, but too small to act as a laptop.If iPads keep getting more expensive without significant software or hardware upgrades I may have to start looking somewhere other than Apple.

reviewTitle: APPLE'S AUTHENTICATION & VERIFICATION PROCESSES HAVE SIMPLY GONE TOO FAR
reviewDescription: Look, I'm sure this thing is the greatest thing since wheat toast, but we bought several of them recently, and it was a stoned-cold nightmare! Tried to initialize it, couldn't, because Apple required one code after another, sent only to iOS devices (what if you're using Android?), followed by iPad lock-outs, forced time-outs, etc., and then the iPad wouldn't even recognize their own freaking codes! Absolute amateurism! Called Apple Tech Support, only to be told that they had no idea what was wrong. Just a complete freaking joke! You've gotta be outta your freakin' mind to support this company.
Bought to draw in and surf apps.I like it very much.
It looked like factory packaging. We’re well done. Fast and reliable. The battery doesn’t last super long.

The new formfactor has some quirks to work though. I would still recommend this version if you want a proven, solid tablet computer with wide app compatibility. Recommended.

I am Android phone user since day 1. Because of that, across the years I bought a lot of Android tablets and even some premium models from Samsung and Asus. The outcome was always the same: every now and then the tablet felt sluggish and frozen.After reading many praises to this model, I gave it a shot given the huge window return for the Holidays and I am keeping this one: fast, nice screen and very responsive touch screen.Highly recommended, removed one star because the audio quality is mediocre and speakers are located at the bottom so you cannot experience the stereo environment. Not a deal breaker as 75% of the time I use it with my earbuds.
I’m older and enjoy reading from my Kindle books. This is perfect for reading.
Heads up this item does NOT come with the pencil and keyboard as depicted. The rest looks fine. I’m going to price out those things and return if appropriate.

My I pad mini was on its last leg and I needed a replacement.this I pad meets and exceeds my expectations. Fast easy to use,setup is way to easy just set my mini next to the new one Follow the instructions done. I am really impress all my games information transfer with no loss and it has all that I could possibly need or use.

reviewDescription: Black screen.  Tried all the suggestions on the web. As far as I can tell it is totally dead.Not too useful as a doorstop.
La batteria vino defectuosa alos dos meses ya no cargaba la batería tube que iniciar la devolución de la tableta, tengo otra la 7th generación asta el dia de hoy trabaja como nueva,

1st: the picture image that is showing on here is NOT the correct image for this model. I bought mine in Oct 2022 and the "on/home" button is on the top NOT on the silver margin. So misrepresentation or image error?2nd: the battery takes 6-7 hours for a full charge IF you can even get it to charge.I have to plug/unplug 5+ times for it to even start charging.3rd: IF it does start charging and after 6 hours you can get a full charge, with minimal use or even NO USE, it will only last about 3 hours.So after only 6 months, with average usage of 14 hours a week, it's become pretty useless and getting worse.I will look into buying an Android from now on. Apple is such a disapppointmentand I do not recommend buying this.

Nothing but issues with this since we got it. First there was some bug that forced us to update right away. Then we realize the camera won't focus, iPad randomly turns on by itself and will start playing music or videos, etc. All Apple wants to do is basic troubleshooting that we've already gone through. Would recommend buying an older model with better feedback, as I hear I'm not alone in the issue I'm having.

reviewTitle: Locked Out of Device After Opting Not to Make a Password - Edit - Amazon Support Helped!
reviewDescription: I thought it would be nice to have a tablet for reading and art, so after some research I found that this iPad would make a really nice combination of both for a pretty reasonable price (especially for apple) I've had many Apple Products: Several iPhones - durability, extended battery life and planned obsolescence obviously annoying but otherwise fine - and one excellent MacBook that lasted me from 2011 to 2022.This item was on the path to being my favorite, until about 4~ish days ago when it decided that I had to put in a passcode to unlock it. For reference - I was asked to do this upon installation, HOWEVER I CHOSE NOT TO DO SO. I understand that means that my information on my iPad was unprotected, but I didn't have any sensitive information on it. The simple solution - give it the good ol' restore via iTunes! Well... It won't connect because I have to put in my non-existent passcode to give my computer access to the device.Oh well! I can always give it a factory reset! Nope. Can't do that. Every time I follow the procedure to do a factory reset, I am locked out of the iPad for EXPPONENTIALLY INCREASING intervals of time.Obviously, I'm annoyed by this. I wanted to see if I could return it and get a new one, so that I can put in a stupid passcode as soon as I set it up, but IN ORDER TO RETURN THE ITEM I NEED TO DO A FACTORY RESET ON IT! Fun fact, that's not possible because every time I follow the procedure for the factory reset, the thing locks me out for longer! So now I have a completely useless iPad. And Amazon support will not assist, and apple will not respond to my inquiries. I hate giving something that has potential to be a good product a bad review, but sadly this one is unusable and I am receiving no assistance. Hopefully nobody else has issues with this kind of thing!Edit: Amazon got in touch with me shortly after review and they offered me a return/refund on the product. Shout out them!

reviewTitle: Just OK, wouldn’t buy another one.
reviewDescription: I’ve had this a few months and it’s generally alright but it has a very annoying “feature” which is more of a bug. It is constantly reloading pages for no apparent reason. Often while I’m reading a long article it takes it upon itself to reload the page even if I’m not touching it. Sometimes I’ll be maybe 5 or so minutes into the article and RELOAD! Now I have to page down until I find where I was.This never happened with my Samsung Galaxy.The only reason I got it was because I needed something with an IOS operating system for a hearing aid app.

reviewTitle: Seemed to be brand new. Not so sure
reviewDescription: It keeps locking me out even with fingerprint. Tried to return and tried speaking to a rep but she kept putting me on hold because she must not have known her job. Stuck with an iPad until I pay even more for someone to fix it so it stops locking me out. 3 stars because it looks fantastic

The hardware itself is no issue, but like a lot of Apple products, I found the device cluttered right away on startup with all kinds of random apps I had no use for. Apple also continues finding ways to be really unintuitive for someone who isn't a lifelong Apple-user. It's fine, but doesn't excel beyond that.

I received my iPad a couple of days ago.  So far so good, except I was surprised to discover that I need to purchase a separate SIMS card for the cellular side of things.  If that is noted anywhere in the description, I fail to see it.  Also, my first attempt at Apple Care was a disappointment.  You can request a callback when contacting them with questions which I did twice with no success.  I tried the messaging option which took over an hour to get answers to 3 simple questions because of the long pauses between responses.  All in all, I am happy to have a new iPad because the battery life on my old one had given out, but I think things could have gone a lot smoother.
Not bad but NOT good . I’ve had it for less then 4 months and it is so bad!
After6 months and having issues with it. No matter what I do I can’t solve the issue
Change is not long lasting. Really it is  bad

After turning my new iPad on, I noticed two specks on the screen. I got a micro fiber cloth and tried to wipe them away, and they didn’t come off.. I took a closer look and realized these specks are under the glass screen ! I paid for a new iPad, not a used or refurbished iPad.. so I’m not 100% satisfied with the purchase.

This iPad died after only five months.  Can not get it to turn on.  Tried both “forced start” methods with no results.  Called Apple support and was told that because it came from Amazon, it did not qualify for expedited replacement.  Will have to send it in and wait two to three weeks for repair.  Apple rep even said it was probably refurbished, but the invoice says it is new.  It was great as long as it worked, thus the review.

This iPad works very well and I was really glad I bought it, but, it has now started to overheat often and shuts down. I don't know whether to return it or if there is someway to fix it. I did buy the warranty.

reviewTitle: Does not come with keyboard or Apple pen
reviewDescription: This item was advertised (both in pictures and in the description) as coming with an Apple pen and smart keyboard. All that came was the iPad and charger (wire and plug). The iPad itself is nice and appears to be new, but the listing needs to change.

I bought my iPad in October of 2022. I rarely use it and noticed that the screen seems to have real issues with screen burn and ghosting. Which is surprising because Apple is known for its quality. The iPad is usable at least for now even with the screen issues. I have a friend who bought their iPad a year or so before I bought mine and has had zero issues.You can see an example of the ghosting screen if you look at the edge of the photo I've posted. In the second photo, you can see the burn-in / ghosting from the icons at the bottom.For those wondering, the screen was not left on for an extended period of time.

reviewTitle: It had a knick on it when it came, kind of disappointing but still works
reviewDescription: I use this product to watch TV or do work

The iPad is great but the battery is stuck at 54%. I’ve had it in the charger for over 30 minutes and it will not go up. When I take the charger out it goes down 3% in another 30 minutes so not really impressed. One of the reasons I got a new iPad and I wanted the battery life. I know this is refurbished but still. reviewTitle: Impossible to set up ... on chat with Apple Support forever ... Useless ... Sending Back ... JUNK
reviewDescription: I have three other iPads. Every one was a joy to use and easy to set up. This piece of junk has eaten several hours of my life trying to get it set up. I tried the hilariously named "Quick Setup" and watched as it took over 90 minutes to get the initial software update (OS) done. This was done on a fast WiFi setup. Then, with my old iPad next to it, I try to transfer data, photos and Apps. It never ever gos anywhere. I let it sit the firs day I got this thing over night and it was in the exact same state ... I reset and tried again. Same thing. I checked the Internet and this is a common problem. One other person with the same problem wrote "Not Ready For Primetime" ... An understatement in my experience. My wife, a lot more patient than I, said try Apple Support. Spent a frustrating 30 minutes with a tech who was less that useless. I told him the problem and he wanted the serial number. However, the iPad was stuck in an update and I had to kill that and ... hard to believe ... it reset itself ... all the way back to the HELLO screen... I even tried to skip the Quick Start option and do setup manually but when I tried to transfer data, it took me v=back to teh never ending data transfer....Sending this one back ... VERY DISAPPOINTED ...

It’s probably doesn’t deserve a one star but no one reads a 3 or 4 star review. I broke the screen fairly severely. Apple offers absolutely zero help unless you enlist in their very expensive AppleCare program and they absolutely despise third parties for making any repairs. Their system is designed for you to buy new products, and repairs are prohibitively expensive. Parts are immensely inflated and expensive. in order to have my iPad repaired,  It was going to be $200 through Apple itself and $180 through a third-party. There’s no way replacing an 11” by 9” piece glass is actually that expensive. They make it that expensive. So I guess I’m stuck with a broken iPad for a couple of years.

reviewTitle: Almost all of my computers and devices are Apple.  Today, I doubt I will ever buy another.
reviewDescription: I was eagerly looking forward to a new ipad, as my old one was showing all the use it has had.  My new one arrived yesterday.  I have apple computers, ipads, and phones, and have enjoyed been a staunch supporter of apple products since the Apple II came out.But my new ipad is horrible.  Well, it may be a great tablet.  But I can't get past all of the disgusting invasive and pervasive built in marketing and advertising to find out.  I bought the ipad.  I paid for it.  But it does not seem to be my device.  It belongs to Apple and their marketing partners and serves as a conduit for all their obnoxious ads.  I don't know if I will ever be able to get all of the intrusive ads to go away.  Shame on you Apple.  I have been a staunch supporter of your products all these years.  Instead of the joy I have always felt about receiving a new Apple product, I simply feel used and betrayed.

No pen or keyboard. I bought this for my granddaughter. She wanted the IPAD with pen and keyboard. The description said "APPLE PENCIL AND SMART KEYBOARD — Apple Pencil (1st generation) transforms iPad into an immersive drawing canvas and the world’s best note‑taking device. The Smart Keyboard features a comfortable typing experience and folds into a slim, lightweight cover for protection. " Anyone can read it on the Amazon page (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09G9FPHY6?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details). the one we received did not come with either, and there wasn't an option to add it on purchase. I feel mislead, adn my granddaughter was so disappointed !!!

This is the worst iPad I have ever owned. I’ve had several iPads through the years. They have all lasted from 2-4 years….this has been a piece of junk since I tuned it on. Constantly freezes, shuts down, touch works about half the time. I’m shocked at the great reviews…I’ve only had about 4 months….I must have been shipped the lemon.I would never purchase an iPad from Amazon again.

reviewTitle: I cancelled my Amazon prime for good
reviewDescription: My daughter saved up and bought this and AppleCare coverage. Amazon shipped an iPad out, but it doesn’t match the serial number on the receipt.The iPad cracked, because it’s of low build quality, but Apple can’t do anything because Amazon messed up the serial number (like they’ve apparently done a LOT).Today is my daughter’s 8th birthday, and after WEEKS of trying to get the problem resolved, I just got notice that they won’t do anything for her. They say it’s been too long, that we didn’t notice their problem fast enough, and now when she wakes up I have to tell her and she’s going to cry.I’ll never buy anything from Amazon or Apple again.

It stopped working or powering up slightly beyond the 15 day window to return!  All trouble shooting at home was unsuccessful. I am at an apple authorized service provider and they cannot get it to power on either. So they are running a diagnostic and will likely have to send it to Apple for further help. I am very disappointed that it didn’t last longer and only worked just long enough to miss Amazons return opportunity. I deserve a new device. A product of this value should have a longer return window. This is my second iPad purchased through Amazon so I though I would have had another good experience.  The first one I had for several years and I just gave it to my grandson then and it is still working. I bought this one. This one must have been defective. Apple/Amazon should replace this defective device that lasted less than 30 days.

This iPad started off great! Worked as intended but unfortunately, after 14 months of use, it just quit. Tried all the fixes, hard resets, ect but it would not power on. Took to a repair shop hoping us was just a bad battery. As it were, critical hardware failure. And since it was two months outside of Apples warranty, they said there was nothing they could do. Very disappointed and can’t bring myself to buy another tablet.

reviewTitle: Huge pain to set up for kids
reviewDescription: Bought this to give to my kid for Christmas. Setting up a child's account is a nightmare and completely unintuitive. It will force my kid to enter an iCloud password each time they want to REQUEST a free app. The whole point of requesting an app is for the parent to be able to approve/deny. Now I either have to make the password something ridiculously easy that my kid can remember (which would be awful for account security) or be there every time they want to install an app. I wish the fire tablets weren't so painfully slow and unreliable otherwise I would have stuck with those.

I spent several hours trying to get this thing setup. Couldn't use my usual email address because it complained that it was already used for some reason. Created a brand new cloud email and it worked for about 10 minutes and then it began asking for my password. Each time I entered it, it complained that my apple id is was not active. The unit was basically completely unusable..prompting for my email password anytime I tried to do anything. Spent the next week trying to get help using chat (which was totally useless) and by phone (never got callback despite multiple attempts). Worst support I've ever seen. Finally returned it out of frustration and bought another kindle fire (for 100$ less) and had it all setup in about 10 minutes. This product is overrated, over priced and under supoorted. Do yourself a favor and buy a kindle instead.

reviewTitle: Glad to have to read kindle books.
reviewDescription: I wanted to use it to read Kindle ebooks,, and for a bit of internet.After I received it, I discovered that this version of Ipad will work with Amazon Prime movie downloads.  Since I can not afford at home internet, is great.  Download at library.At home I have Hot Spot on Iphone to look at weather and news.I would have preferred the latest iPad with the most of memory and so on.  but this was affordable,  and EOL (End of Life, when Apple will not longer update OS) is a while in the future.I delayed opening box until I had, in hand, a stick on screen protector, and a case.  Being poor i got a cheap silicone case like a child would use.  I don't anticipate breaking it.I bought monthly version of Apple Care Plus.  Apple care advice phone is like having a geek who is a best friend, and who has all the time in the world to be helpful.  and who has a good grasp of how to talk to someone not technically knowledgeable at all.  Apple Care is the support that you always thought a computer support guys should be.  At least that is my previous experience with Apple Care.  Actually paying more for fixing hardware, that is why I bought case.Get a case.  Don't open iPad box until you are ready to put case on.
Like every Apple product that’s is a really good option in the relation price-quality, I’m content creator and this iPad be my best friend and my principal tool for work.
I bought last week, my ipad coming new with box even, absolutly amazing. Thanks for amazon and seller, want to buy 1 more

reviewTitle: Great Device for Both College Students
reviewDescription: We purchased two of these for our college-aged kids.  They are invaluable to them.  Our nursing student has tod us that EVERY nursing student uses an iPad in class. Also, there is no need to purchase the next generation, this generation is more than enough!
Great Ipad! Haven't had any issues with it so far. Color on the screen is great, sound is as expect from an Ipad and overall very happy with this purchase!

I wish a lot of the apps were free for it mostly of apps for kids, productivity or anything else have to have a payment plan. But it’s great for other things specially if you buy the accessories for it like the keyboard, pen and case.
My other iPad was old and no longer working.  This iPad works much better and it does what I need for it to do.

I love it and can't think of being without it!Additionally.....I often watch TV on it, using headphones. The headphone jack is on the opposite side from the charging port. I comfortably survived an especially loud, explosive New Years Eve watching a movie and other shows until the neighborhood "calmed down". 👍

reviewTitle: Not sure how long it will last tho….
reviewDescription: Pros: I love the size, the screen is clear, takes really good photos, no damage to the front or back, the ports work and the volume and power buttons work.Cons: It takes forever to pull something up and then it says the server couldn’t connect and it’s not our Wi-Fi bc my husbands phone doesn’t have this problem...it all started after about 6 months of use. X-ing out of a tab doesn’t work every time and the Battery life isn’t strong as well. I have to close it down, wait for a while and restart it.

It’s good, a little bit mediocre to be my first smart tablet ever. I expected the magic pen to be a little bit more sensitive to the touch screen.However, it is a great iPad for kids that is going to college for the first time or if you want an iPad kid (slave ) for the rest of your life

reviewTitle: Good, but battery hasn't lasted long
reviewDescription: I bought this 10 months ago and for the most part it's been good! I use it for digital art and although it's not the best iPad for that it gets the job done. My only issue is that the battery life has decreased a lot since I first bought it.

Really good overall, no problems with the touch screen or camera. However, it has a tendency to go from 90% to dead in a few hours WITHOUT use. There is no slow recording of drainage, just 90% and then dead.I will go some days without using it and will check on it's battery during the off days and it will be pretty high, but then the next day when I do want to use it it's completely dead. Really thought it was a decent buy, but now I'm reconsidering.

I’m all Apple, but this screen is very sensitive to the touch. Working out how to rotate between horizontal and vertical without the screen rotating back immediately. I wouldn’t say don’t buy it. I’m hoping these issues will go away.

I would not buy this iPad again ... way too frustrating.

I have never had this trouble with any other purchase from Amazon.

The camera is not that great!It has some good features though like it detects you and moves the direction of the camera wherever you go during facetime which I really liked.Also just to let you know it is a 720 px resolution which I expected more from apple.Try to add 150$ bucks more if you can and get the latest as this one doesn't have apple pencil magnetic charging too.But if you just need it for taking notes during class then it does the job pretty well which is why I am sticking to this.

reviewTitle: Problems with no help from Apple
reviewDescription: Mine was delivered 7/31/23. About 3 weeks later, I went to sign on was got a message that the device was not available and to wait 1 minute.  waited several, tried again, now says wait 5 minutes, then it was 15 and then and hour. spent two hours on the phone with apple support and was unable to get in. took it to the apple store next day, wiped out the hard drive and reloaded.. All was fine for another two weeks and it happend again. but this time, after about 15 hours, it allowed me to sign on. took it to the store as I hada appt., they ran diagnostics and said they could not find anything wrong.. then it happened a couple of more times. Apple was no help, Amazon did not want to help as the return period had expired, but eventually they allowed me to return it..other than the fact that it would not let me in when I needed to use it, it was a good machine. but cannot give it a glowing report. Still waiting on the refund so that I can purchase another computer. not sure if it will be an apple.  bad taste in my mouth.Update-  ended up buying a Generation 10 iPad ($50 less than the Generation  9) from Target.  Same storage and larger screen. Very happy with purchase

reviewTitle: Bad Past Experiences with Apple Products
reviewDescription: Based on the fact that I have an iPad that locked up on a senior and, because she had an obsolete email ID and forgot her password, Apple customer service refused to unlock it: I am not very impressed with the iPad and will be getting a Google Pixel or Amazon Fire for her instead. There are so many better options out there. There's no excuse that we should have to have an expensive piece of equipment like this be locked and worthless after spending hundreds of dollars on it so the company can be rewarded for forcing us to buy another of their products.

There's no SD card slot for this or any of the apple products.  That's why I switched over to samsung Galaxy tab and phones.  At least I can upgrade my storage instead of being forced to pay Apple a monthly fee for Apple Air storage.

reviewTitle: I was expecting case and keyboard as it says "About this item"
reviewDescription: Box just arrived w/o case or keyboard.  Very misleading, I might say, deceptive."About this itemWHY IPAD — All the essentials in the most affordable iPad, with a beautiful 10.2-inch Retina display, powerful A13 Bionic chip, and an Ultra Wide front camera with Center Stage. Work, play, create, learn, stay connected, and more.IPADOS + APPS — iPadOS makes iPad more productive, intuitive, and versatile. With iPadOS, run multiple apps at once, use Apple Pencil to write in any text field with Scribble, and edit and share photos. iPad comes with essential apps like Safari, Messages, and Keynote, with over a million more apps available on the App Store.FAST WI-FI CONNECTIVITY — Fast Wi-Fi keeps you connected at home, work, school, or wherever you go with your iPad.PERFORMANCE AND STORAGE — The A13 Bionic chip gives you the graphics performance you need. And with all-day battery life, iPad is perfect for playing immersive games and more. Choose from 64GB or 256GB storage options.APPLE PENCIL AND SMART KEYBOARD — Apple Pencil (1st generation) transforms iPad into an immersive drawing canvas and the world’s best note‑taking device. The Smart Keyboard features a comfortable typing experience and folds into a slim, lightweight cover for protection.10.2-INCH RETINA DISPLAY — With incredible detail and vivid colors, it’s perfect for watching movies or drawing your next masterpiece. True Tone adjusts the display to the color temperature of the room to make viewing comfortable in any light.UNLOCK AND PAY WITH TOUCH ID — Touch ID is built into the top button, so you can use your fingerprint to unlock your iPad, sign in to apps, and make payments securely with Apple Pay."

We had the previous model, bought barely over two years ago and it suddenly quit working. Our daughter loved it and had a lot of apps on it and was using it for school but we're reluctant to buy another one if it's just going to die after two years. It just wouldn't turn on one day and I brought it to an Apple store where they ran a diagnostic on it and confirmed that it was a brick. They were happy to replace it with the same model for $250 or to sell me a new one. No thanks. Very disappointed in Apple's quality and will stick with other manufacturers (for example we have a 7-year old Motorola phone and a 6-year old Fire tablet that still work fine - they're mostly obsolete but they still turn on).
until they make these expandable and the ability to download netflix shows im not buying another one, Samsung allows this and its too important to give up.

reviewDescription: This review is about Amazon and not Apple product quality. I ordered an iPad thinking it was from the apple store but it’s sold by Amazon BTW. There is no way to return the item direct to a UPS store so prepare to sit home waiting for a pickup. I learned this by speaking with Amazon customer service which is the most frustrating experience ever!! Have you ever called them? Good luck understanding them!!  I’m hoping UPS calls before the pickup since I couldn’t understand the woman. I order a lot on Amazon but never again with big items! Ugh

reviewTitle: iPad won't stay connected to WiFi
reviewDescription: I realzie this is an Apple product. We connect this iPad to our WiFi. It works. If you go to use the iPad hte next day it looks like it is connected to WiFi, but it isn't. I have to tell it to forget the WiFi connection, reconnect it and then it works fine. I contacted Apple. They reviewed several settings. We thought we had it working, but the same problem persists. All of our other devices connect to our WiFi without an issue. Some of these devices are Apple products, some are from other manufacturers. When it actually is connected to WiFi it works fine.

Received this iPad and 3 days later it wouldn't turn on!! Called Apple support and they tried every avenue available but stated it needed to be taken to an Apple //store location to determine the issue...instructed to go to Best Buy in Olympia...called and couldn't get an appointment for 4 days!!! took it there on the scheduled appointment...technician stated the battery was shot and so was the iPad...called Amazon they told me I should have contacted them instead of going to an Apple store but then I was instructed to go to a different App Store in the Tacoma Mall....long story short iPad is not repairable and as far as I am concerned Amazon has dine nothing for me other than schedule a pickup of the defective iPad...what a joke...all my time wasted running to 2 different locations and chatting with Amazon about what they would do to Mae it good as a Prime Amazon member...NOTHING!  Drove to Olympia to Target they price matched and I got a brand new now for the same amount Amazon quoted...but no wait time!!! Won't be buying any large ticket items from Amazon /EVER again...my advice is don't do business with them!!

From my use of an iPad mini, I expected that the iPad 9th generation 10.2 inch would be like the mini only with a larger screen. Although that's true, I find the larger iPad easier and more satisfying to use because of the larger retina display and plethora of features provided by the latest version of ipadOS. I am not an Apple fanatic, but I do appreciate many of the high quality features and programs available on the iPad. Up to now I've been more in the Samsung Android ecosystem with my Galaxy S21 phone and S9 tablet. After spending a lot of time these past few days enjoying the new iPad, I might have to rethink this basic position.

reviewTitle: Great deal on a great tablet
reviewDescription: I found a great deal: $249 for a *NEW* iPad 9.  I know it's one product release back and it's right up there with buying last year's car model.  But it's new and the fit and finish is perfect.  It was super easy and smooth to set up and configure.  The rest is standard my iPad is great stuff.This is an upgrade from an iPad Air 2.  I'm sure the hardware on this old iPad is capable of much more than it was delivering.  But it's Apple's way of forcing you to move up to a newer platform.  They're not alone - If they were, I'd still be using Windows 95 at work...Bottom line - I got a great deal on a tremendous iPad.*Update*  This was a birthday gift for my mom.  She was the one upgrading from the old iPad.  After just a few days she told me that she absolutely LOVES her new iPad.  I'm happy.

This was for my 90-year-old Mom, who uses it primarily for email and facetiming with her friends.  I don't know about Apple products and was concerned about the data transfer from her old iPad to her new one, but it was very easy.  Obviously, Mom was thrilled.  Her old iPad (Gen 2) had been dropped so often that it was literally coming apart.  It was time.  She is saving it as a backup.  Bless her heart.

I wish the entry level iPad had USB-C instead of lightning but it's hard to argue with the value for this tablet.Pros- Fast and runs all my apps- Good battery life-  Fast A13 Bionic Chip- Supports Apple Pencil and Magic Keyboard- Lowest Cost iPadCons- Still uses lightning- Doesn't use laminated display

I’ve had my new iPad by 3 months now and couldn’t love it more. Easy to use, accessible. I’ve used for entertainment, studying, painting, writing. This iPad can really make it all. Completely worth it for the price, updated and still has a couple of years ahead to be used. Really really recommend, especially adding keyboard and pencil. This can totally substitute any laptop or computer for the day to day activities.

This is a great iPad for the price. You have to understand, you are getting what you pay for, you do not plan on doing anything crazy on this is iPad, or you want something for your child. This is a great product to buy them. Obviously i recommend some accessories, but just by itself, it serves my purpose for not taking notes, some occasional games here there, like casual cod mobile or some auto clicker games, and some occasional media consumption. Looks good, very bright, and great inside.

I bought this to replace a Lenovo tablet that I had been using for a few years. The Lenovo tablet was okay, but I wanted a larger screen and more built-in storage. Plus, I wanted iOS instead of Android. My phone is an iPhone and after using both operating systems extensively, I just prefer iOS. I use my iPad every day and I'm very glad I finally made the upgrade.

i love this ipad! its perfect for watching movies and playing games. it runs fast, is very responsive, and the transfer of data from my iphone 15 was not super quick, but not horribly slow (the whole process was maybe about 45 minutes, but that is due to slow wifi not anything to do with the tablet). i got this as somewhat of a cheap replacement for my degrading laptop until i can buy another one, and so i don’t have to lug my laptop around on vacations anymore. the battery life, while not groundbreaking, is very decent and what you’d expect from an apple product. the screen is beautiful and clear. everything runs as smooth as butter, and 64GB of space is more than enough for someone who’s just doing casual stuff like me. i definitely plan on buying more accessories for it like a pencil and a keyboard! it’s definitely going to become my new best friend, i’m obsessed. if you really wanna use your ipad outside of the house in a place you may not have wifi, don’t waste your money buying the cellular one and then adding it to your data plan, that’s such a big waste of money!! use a mobile hotspot on your phone instead, it’s a completely free alternative that works just as well.

I bought this ipad as a gift for my wife. (She asked for it). I never saw it work. She brought it to me later in the day to show me it was locked (disabled).  I hate Apple products, but I downloaded and installed iTunes on my Windows PC in an attempt to rescue this device from its disabled state. iTunes choked my PC, then it choked itself. Finally got it working, got logged into iTunes, and began an iPad restore. After an hour, I got an error saying it was unable to restore the device. Tried it again. No joy. Called Apple support and they had me repeat the same steps. I told them it wasn't going to work, but they insisted. They told me let the restore run again, and they would call me back in 30 minutes. That was 2 days ago. Haven't heard back from them. The restore process failed (as expected). Now the device is stuck in restore mode. I have repeatedly tried all the google remedies to free it from restore mode, but none of them work. Its still in restore mode, and I can't even power the damn thing off. What a nightmare!!! I've wasted nearly 2 days following the instructions on this time vampire, and it went from bad to worse!

reviewTitle: iPad is no longer top of the heap
reviewDescription: Compared to our Samsung Galaxy tablet from 3 years ago, this newer 9th gen iPad is clearly inferior. The sound is not half as good. Honestly, this is a big deficiency. We played the same song on both at the same time to compare. The screen is good but not as rich, vivid, beautiful and dazzling as our Samsung.  Samsung wins on camera too. Battery life is good, but again, not nearly as good as the Samsung. The processor speed is good, and this is the only plus in comparison. I think we're paying for Apple name and reputation now. The product seems secondary. It is no longer top of the heap in direct comparison.  Sorry, Apple, you're playing catch up now.  It hurts me to state that.

reviewTitle: Apple does it again, the best of Apple in a great price!
reviewDescription: I have had my iPad 9th Generation 64GB Wi-Fi since the end of November, 2022. It has been about 5 months. I upgraded from an iPad Air 2 32GB Wi-Fi (2014 model) that I had for almost 6 years! I have to say that there is a reason why Apple iPads are sold at such a premium price. That's because they provide valuable practical use for far longer than the vast majority of what is available in the tablet market.With that said the 2021 iPad 9th Generation is a base iPad with a limited amount of fancy features and a dated iPad design. Quite frankly, I actually use my iPad on the go and all of the iPads I have had go directly into an Otterbox Defender case. So I hardly notice the little aesthetics in design when my iPads area always in an Otterbox Defender case.I won't make this review long and will highlight the particular reason why I feel the need to write this review at all. I would say there's three top reasons why I believe the iPad 9th generation is excellent: 1. Good CPU performance/64GB base memory capacity, 2. Value pricing, and 3. Apple Pencil/Freeform.1. CPU performance is good with the A13 CPU from the iPhone 11. I am confident that I will be able to use this iPad for at least 4 more years, if not 5. I bought my iPad Air 2 (2014 model) in 2016 and it was supported with OS updates up until iPadOS 15, which is a total of 8 years. But the iPad Air 2 was among the longest supported iPads in Apple's tablet history. So it is not likely to be repeated. But I think that the iPad 9th generation should be supported for at least 6 years, 2021 to 2027. Plus, the 64GB base capacity is excellent for my basic use of the iPad.2. The pricing for the iPad 9th Generation 64GB retails at $329.99, but it is often for sale at $269.99. That's how much I purchased it for during Cyber Monday 2022. It has been on sale for as low as $249.99 at some other retailers as well. So overall, the pricing is very affordable for a device this capable with support for many years to come.3. I know that the Apple Pencil has been out for years, but I have only now tried it. It was not supported with my iPad Air 2 (2014 model) and I never gave it much thought as being useful to me. I always thought that the Apple Pencil was geared towards artists, which to some extent it is. I tried the Apple Pencil on my iPad 9th Generation about a month after getting mine. It was a revolutionary experience for me. I have been looking for a viable substitute for a whiteboard for the longest time. But there is not any real replacement for what you can do on a whiteboard. The Apple Pencil with FreeForm is the closest that I've come to the experience I get on a whiteboard. Although, I do still use a 4'x8' whiteboard for some brainstorming sessions, the Apple Pencil has afforded me to do some basic brainstorming in FreeForm. This is a massive benefit and I can only see Apple getting better with its FreeForm app. Not to mention app developers releasing new apps to take advantage of the Apple Pencil for brainstorming on a virtual whiteboard.Overall, I highly recommend the iPad 9th Generation.

reviewTitle: Remote management won’t let me setup my new iPad
reviewDescription: Update: Contacted the seller and they were able to walk me through removing the block. I’ll change the stars to 3, because I still think a wipe should have been done before selling the iPad and because I spent quite a bit of time on the phone with Amazon and texting with the seller. But the issue was fixed and iPad is working.Purchased this refurbished iPad on Amazon while I was away abroad. Came home, picked it up and left again, only to find out I can’t set it up at all, because it has remote management configuration on it, which, according to Apple, hasn’t been released by the previous organization-owner. Basically, the iPad that I thought will be mine is remotely managed by the previous owner (never mind that it is supposed to be fully refurbished), and I can’t go further than turning it on.The iPad is useless, might as well hammer in nails with it, it doesn’t work because of this remote management thing. Amazon refused to help, because the return period has ended (“nothing we can do” was their exact answer). I’m furious. Never thought anything like this could happen with Amazon and their partners. Do not recommend ANY refurbished electronics from Amazon, and by how they are handling this, will most likely never buy anything from them at all.

reviewTitle: Uninspiring IPAD with lots of issues
reviewDescription: I bought this IPAD with high expectations, however, it has done nothing but disappointed.  First, all of Apple's requirements to make an Apple ID, password, passcode, is extremely dragged out.  The process to set up the tablet is extremely long and having to remember all the passwords are difficult.  Second, a lot of the screen is actually blacked out on the side.  I wanted to see the whole screen while watching movies and videos, not parts of it.  Third, some parts of the IPAD is unresponsive.  I had to click multiple times in order for the tablet to register what I was trying to do.  Fourth, the fingerprint requirement is a pain.  When my son wants to download an app for gaming, I have to go over and have it take my fingerprint.  An annoying and unnecessary step.  Fifth, storage is horrible when you download regular games.  I suggest buying the more storage option.  Sixth, the battery is terrible.  I was expecting the battery to rival Samsung Tablets, however, that was not the case.  The IPAD dies quickly even when on low power mode.  Not what I was expecting when I spent hundreds on a tablet.  Onto a more positive note, I do believe that the built quality is up to standard and it was nice that Apple included the charging brick and cables.Pros:1. Built quality is good2. Accessories (charging brick and cable) were includedCons:1. Long set up times2. Very large black bars on the side3. Some spots were unresponsive unless repeatedly tapped on4. Fingerprint system is a hassle5. Storage for apps is horrible6. VERY VERY short battery life!

Minus: controls on screen too small and hard to hit.  No way to make it look like a bigger iPhone, for people with bad eyesight - they just cram more stuff on screen assuming everybody has a magnifier glass handy when using the tablet.Also, icons are too small for the screen size - you get a lot of screen real estate not used around them, with no way to change the distance between icons (to get more icons per screen) or make them bigger.DucDuck and other browsers / apps have control boxes which are too small and not responsive.Plus:  worked out of the box, good networking, good audio (especially considering the thickness), good range of accessories available on the net
